intro: Xysmalobium spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has palmately compound leaves with five to seven leaflets and produces small, follicle-like fruits. Xysmalobium spathulatum is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and ecological diversity.
